item.title: 8 Best Horror Games That Surprised Players, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • An innovative co-op horror game like "Phasmophobia" proves that unique approaches in horror gaming can be successful.
  • "Resident Evil 7: Biohazard" made a monumental comeback by changing up its formula, focusing on horror, and shifting to a first-person perspective.
  • "Alien: Isolation" is a licensed horror game that exceeded expectations, delivering revolutionary enemy AI and gameplay.

Technically, most horror games pride themselves on surprising players and scaring them out of their wits. However, that might be taking this sentiment a bit too literally.

Given how restrictive this genre may seem at times, it's easy to see why horror games that take risks that end up working deserve all the praise in the world. Players are taken aback by how simple changes and unexpected horror titles can surprise them with the quality on display.

8 Phasmophobia

No One Expected A Co-op Horror Game To Be So Effective

Phasmophobia
10.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Use of Drugs, Violence
Powered by

Co-op and horror are not something fans will usually group together. However, games like Phasmophobia make it clear that this approach is more than viable in the industry and then some.

Teaming up with friends to figure out the identity of a ghost they need to exorcize is riveting and makes for a fun time without downplaying the game's horror elements. Being hounded by a ghost or losing sight of the other ghost hunters can be a nerve-wracking experience as players retreat to safety.

7 Slay The Princess

The Plot Goes Down Some Wild And Surprising Routes

6 Images
6 Images
Slay the Princess
9.3 /10
Released
October 23, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

As eerie as Slay the Princess looks at first glance, players have no idea about the wild ride they're in for when they check this game out. They are stuck in an eternal quest to take out a princess who is seemingly an eldritch nightmare, only for the truth to be way grander than fans expected.

The scenes in this visual novel are disturbing and do a great job of portraying a cosmic horror story. Players who give this title a shot will be left amazed at how engaging this video game is.

6 Resident Evil 7: Biohazard

A Monumental Comeback For The Series After It Floundered For The Longest Time

Resident Evil 7: Biohazard
12
9.0 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Switch, Stadia, PC
Powered by

After P.T. , it was clear to Capcom that the Resident Evil franchise could make a comeback by changing up its formula. Fans expecting a third-person romp were already surprised when Biohazard shifted to a first-person perspective.

Ties to the franchise were kept to a minimum in this revival, and the focus on horror was amped to the max, to the point where many people consider this to be the scariest Resident Evil game ever made. Biohazard was a much-needed change of pace for the series that fans loved.

5 Parasite Eve

A Short Horror JRPG Released In A Time When The Games Were Long And Fantasy-Oriented

Parasite Eve
7.8 /10
Released
September 9, 1998

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Animated Violence, Mature Sexual Themes
Developer(s)
Square
Platform(s)
PS1
Powered by

In an age when JRPGs were lengthy and focused on grand, fantastical adventures, Parasite Eve took a completely different route. The modern-day setting was refreshing, and fans were taken aback by the major focus on body horror in this title from the get-go.

This made for a refreshing experience that let fans enjoy a JRPG that wasn't by-the-numbers in the slightest. Even now, Parasite Eve is one of Squaresoft's most riveting PS1 JRPGs, which is why a remake of this title can potentially be in high demand.

4 Alien: Isolation

A Licensed Horror Game That Had No Business Being So Excellent

Alien: Isolation
6 /10
27
9.6 /10
Released
October 7, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Creative Assembly
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Switch, PC, Android, iOS
Powered by

Alien: Isolation is one of the most surprising horror games that does justice to its license and the immersive sim genre as well. As Amanda Ripley, players embark on a hunt for her mother aboard the Sevastopol space station that is full of hostiles and xenomorphs.

Boasting revolutionary enemy AI and surprisingly riveting gameplay, Alien: Isolation came out of nowhere to become one of the best horror games ever made. Fans are missing out on something special if they don't give this title a shot.

3 Inscryption

An Experimental Game That Takes Some Wild Turns

Inscryption
8.8 /10
Released
October 19, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

From the moment Inscryption unveils its atmospheric trappings, fans will be in it for the long haul. Trying to take out Leshy while coming to grips with how the card game mechanics work is a blast and makes Inscryption a joy to play.

However, it's not until players make substantial progress that this game's true trappings start rearing their head. These surprises arrive constantly to catch players unawares and make Inscryption one of the boldest and most engaging horror games players can get their hands on.

2 Dead Space

A Remake That Was Way Better Than Fans Expected

Dead Space (2023)
9 /10
13
8.4 /10
Released
January 27, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Rated M for Mature for Blood and Gore, Strong Language, and Intense Violence.
Developer(s)
EA Motive
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Dead Space is not a game for the faint of heart, with most of its fans loving this 2008 horror game. However, even its biggest fans felt that a remake of this horror masterpiece was unnecessary, only for this title to knock their socks off.

Not only does the game look better than ever before, but the USG Ishimura's areas have also been expanded upon organically to give returning players a pleasant surprise, too. The game's strengths remain intact and ensure that players will love what Dead Space brings to the table.

1 P.T.

A Playable Teaser That Became More Popular Than Most Fully-Fledged Horror Games

P.T.
Survival Horror
Systems
5.5 /10
Released
August 12, 2014
ESRB
m

Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Platform(s)
PS4
Powered by

To this day, fans rue what they missed out on with a Silent Hill game developed by Kojima himself. After all, P.T. itself was such a major surprise that it changed the horror landscape for good, and a full game with this genius' inputs would've been something magical.

Even if his grand vision was never achieved, that should take nothing away from what the rest of P.T. brings to the table. The looping hallway, Lisa's erratic movements, and the obtuse puzzles all led to this playable teaser into a surprise horror masterpiece that fans rave about to this day.

item.title: 8 Canceled Marvel Superhero Games, Explained
item.description:
Summary

  • A Black Panther game by Cliffhanger Games was canceled by EA in 2025, after two years of development.
  • Insomniac Games' Spider-Man: The Great Web is a scrapped live service multiplayer project.
  • Neversoft's Ghost Rider 2D sidescroller was canceled in the 90s due to demand for fully 3D games.

Marvel is one of the biggest comic book companies in the world. Among its many multimedia projects, it has released several video games that have allowed players to control some of its most iconic superheroes and super villains. Gamers have gotten to play as their favorite characters in Marvels Spider-Man , Guardians of the Galaxy , Marvel: Ultimate Alliance , Marvel Rivals, and many more.

However, not every Marvel gaming project has seen the light of the day. Over the years, multiple developers have revealed fascinating information about video games based off of Marvel superheroes that were sadly canceled before they were completed. This has happened many times, and across multiple console generations, but these canceled Marvel video games are the most interesting ones so far.

8 Black Panther

By Cliffhanger Games

While Black Panther has always been a beloved superhero with a lot of cultural significance, his mainstream popularity skyrocketed after his first live-action movie in 2018. Marvel fans were craving game in which they could play as TChalla and explore the advanced land of Wakanda. Fortunately, Electronic Arts announced exactly that in 2023.

This new Black Panther video game was being developed by a brand-new studio called Cliffhanger Games. For almost two years, not much information was disclosed about this project, and fans were wondering when Marvel and EA were going to reveal more. Unfortunately, in May 2025, Electronic Arts finally confirmed that the game was canceled and that Cliffhanger Games was being shut down, resulting in a slew of layoffs at the company. This was an unfortunate turn of events, especially because Black Panther has so much potential for a fun and unique video game.

7 Spider-Man: The Great Web

By Insomniac Games

In December 2023, Insomniac Games was hacked. This resulted in the leaking of private information about the company, including personal information of its employees and some content from unreleased video games. This unfortunate situation heavily affected Insomniac Games, but it also allowed fans to learn about a canceled Spider-Man multiplayer experience called Spider-Man: The Great Web .

This was going to be a live service video game taking place in Insomniacs Marvels Spider-Man universe and inspired by the Spider-Verse event. Players would have been able to control different multiversal Spider-People (like Peter, Miles and Gwen), who would join forces to fight a version of the Sinister Six. While this was an interesting concept for a multiplayer game, some fans believe that it was for the best it was scrapped, since recent live service superhero games (like Marvels Avengers or Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League ) have been huge commercial failures.

6 Marvel: World of Heroes

By Niantic Labs

Pokemon GO took the world by storm back in 2016, inspiring other big companies to release augmented reality games based off of their own intellectual properties. Monster Hunter Now , Harry Potter: Wizards Unite , Pikmin Bloom, and came out as a result. All of these projects were also made by Pokemon GO s developer, Niantic Labs. It should be no surprise that, at one point, Marvel hired the studio to make an AR mobile game with Marvel superheroes, titled Marvel: World of Heroes .

This was going to be a mobile video game with geolocation-based AR gameplay and many playable Marvel characters, like Doctor Strange, Cyclops, Spider-Man and Thor. However, in June 2023 (a few months after its original announcement), Niantic announced that, due to a major organizational shift within the company, it had closed down its Los Angeles studio and stopped production on Marvel: World of Heroes .

5 The Avengers

By THQ Studio Australia

2012s The Avengers was a worldwide cinematic phenomenon. It not only turned the Marvel Cinematic Universe into the cultural juggernaut it is today, but it also cemented its titular characters as the biggest superhero team on the planet. Fans began asking Marvel to make a video game in which they could play as these heroes at the same time. Curiously enough, one tied to the aforementioned movie was actually being developed at one point.

Before the movie even came out, THQ Studio Australia was working on The Avengers , a tie-in action game that would have allowed players to take control of the titular teams heroes, each with their own distinct gameplay style. Iron Man could fly around and shoot projectiles, Hulk could smash enemies with his fists, etc. This promising Avengers game was canceled because THQ was going through a major financial crisis. It had to shut down its Australian studio and scrap most of its projects, before going bankrupt in 2012.

4 Marvel: Chaos

By Electronic Arts Chicago

Marvel has had an interesting history with the fighting game genre, with both great successes (like the iconic Marvel vs. Capcom series) and colossal failures (like Marvel Nemesis: Rise of the Imperfects ). However, and unbeknownst to most comic book fans, there was almost a hyperrealistic fighting game starring Marvel characters. It was made by Electronic Art Chicago, the studio behind games like Def Jam: Icon and Fight Night Round 2 .

Titled Marvel: Chaos , this fighter was revealed during San Diego Comic-Con 2007 and canceled a few months later, because EA decided to shut down its Chicago studio (among many others). An Xbox 360 prototype of Marvel: Chaos leaked on the internet a few years later. It looked fun, showing a 3D arena fighter with a cast of beloved comic book characters and destructible environments. It would have been great to experience Marvel: Chaos but, with Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls coming out in the near future, fighting game aficionados will get their Marvel fix soon.

3 The Invincible Iron Man

By Genepool Software

Despite being such an iconic superhero nowadays, Iron Man hasnt had the best record when it comes to video game representation. While fans are hoping that EA and Motive Studios upcoming Iron Man game will finally give Tony Stark the time to shine, it was also recently discovered that another fascinating video game starring Iron Man was being developed during the mid-2000s.

This canceled project, titled The Invincible Iron Man , was revealed by Kevin Edwards, a former Genepool Software developer, back in 2023. The studio began working on a stylish Iron Man third-person adventure for PS2, Xbox, and PC shortly after the release of its previous Marvel game, X2: Wolverine's Revenge . Based on the pictures that Edwards revealed, this game looked quite good. But according to him, Activision canceled the game when the Iron Man film was delayed and the studio was closed down. This is a real shame, because The Invincible Iron Man could have been the glorious video game debut that Iron Man deserves.

2 Daredevil: The Man Without Fear

By 5000ft Inc.

Daredevil is another iconic Marvel superhero that still hasnt received a proper single-player video game of his own. It's disappointing, because the idea of playing as a crime-fighting blind vigilante with advanced hearing and acrobatic expertise sounds promising. In the early 2000s, 5000ft Inc. (developers of Army Men: Green Rogue ) worked on a Daredevil video game for PS2, Xbox and PC.

In Daredevil: The Man Without Fear , players would have taken control of Matt Murdock as he patrolled the streets of Hells Kitchen, beating up gangs and trying to find Elektra. The gameplay was reminiscent of the Spider-Man console games released around that time, but with Daredevils grappling hook instead of spiderwebs and his augmented hearing instead of spider-sense. Daredevil: The Man Without Fear looked like an interesting and faithful adaptation of the iconic hero, but it went through a tumultuous development process with many setbacks until Marvel canceled it in 2004. This game was so far in development that an early playable build was uploaded onto the internet in 2023.

1 Ghost Rider

By Neversoft Entertainment

Weirdly enough, Ghost Rider has had better representation in video games than other, more well-known, Marvel characters. The 2007 video game adaptation of his first live-action film is fondly remembered as a solid (albeit derivative) hack-and-slash experience. But most people dont know that Neversoft Entertainment, developers of the original Tony Hawks Pro Skater tetralogy, was actually working on a Ghost Rider video game back in the late 90s.

This was a 2D sidescroller with 3D environments and impressive real lighting effects that looked quite good for its time, not to mention that its dynamic whip-based combat made it look a lot like a Castlevania game. Unfortunately, the publisher, Crystal Dynamics, ended up canceling Ghost Rider. Executives believed that it had to be a fully 3D experience in order to succeed, which was a common sentiment during that transitional period of the video game industry.

item.title: Another Crab's Treasure Dev Has a New Co-Op Game Coming on June 16
item.description:
The developer of Another Crab's Treasure has announced that its new game Peak will come out on June 16. In addition to Aggro Crab, which developed the indie hit Another Crab's Treasure and the roguelike Going Under , the project involves Landfall, the developer responsible for other well-known independent games Content Warning and Totally Accurate Battle Simulator .

Another Crab's Treasure won the hearts of players and became one of the best independent games of 2024. In this charismatic Soulslike, players control Krill, a crab who sets out on an adventure to recover his shell. Content Warning also came out in 2024, and despite its colorful and friendly graphics, it is a game in which players must do spooky things if they want to go viral. Totally Accurate Battle Simulator is a 2021 title in which players pit red and blue armies against each other, with wobbly physics always resulting in hilarious situations. Now, the developers of these popular indie games have teamed up on a new project.

Aggro Crab has announced that Peak will be released on June 16 via Steam. In this new co-op game for PC, players can venture out alone or with up to three friends. The goal is to climb a mountain to its center, as this is the only way to save a mysterious island. To do so, players must help each other get past ledges, set up ropes, and climb spikes as they pass through four different biomes, each with its own dangerous obstacles.

Aggro Crab to Release Peak, a New Game Where Falling Off a Mountain Can Be Fatal

While climbing, Peak players must search for 30 questionable foods to survive, find items to help them reach the highest point of the mountain, and tend to their injuries. This adds an element of a survival game to Peak because it makes the quest even more risky, as each issue limits the players' stamina, making climbing increasingly hard. The game's Steam page also lists player character customization as one of its features, which will potentially allow players to switch between different accessories and outfits.

According to the trailer released by Aggro Grab on its Twitter account, most of Peak 's development took place during a month-long game jam. The game's main selling point is its co-op, which makes it a good option for casual gameplay. However, since it also supports solo play, those who prefer to enjoy co-op games alone hope that Peak delivers the same engaging, colorful, and fun experience in its simplicity.

item.title: 10 Sims 4 Expansions That Let You Live Your Best Cozy Gaming Life
item.description:
Summary

  • The Sims 4 offers a wide range of DLC content and a modding community for fans to customize their gaming experience.
  • The Blooming Rooms, Golden Years, and Comfy Gamer kits offer unique customization options for players' Sims homes and characters.
  • DLC packs like Nifty Knitting, Crystal Creations, Tiny Living, and more provide cozy and fun gameplay experiences for players.

The Sims series has always encouraged players to choose their own playstyle, whether they're passionate about creating Sims in CAS, building impressive homes, or causing mayhem between characters in live mode.

The vast array of DLC content available for The Sims 4 , alongside the games thriving modding community, means that there is plenty of additional content available for fans to customize their gameplay experience. With the upcoming Enchanted by Nature expansion pack on the horizon, promising to treat players to a whimsical world of cozy delights, here are the best Sims 4 add-ons to buy if youre looking to build the perfect cozy gaming experience.

1 Blooming Rooms Kit

Turn A Sims Home Into A Luscious Green Escape

  • DLC type : Kit
  • Release date : November 2021

The Blooming Rooms kit gives green-thumbed Simmers the chance to bring the outside world in by turning their virtual home into a green oasis filled with plants. The large range of flora available in the kit allows for a really eye-catching transformation of homes and facilities within the game world, and was even made available for free by EA for a short period of time.

Its a simple yet surprisingly effective kit that brings a lot of life to the in-game world, and is one of several outdoorsy expansions available, including the Romantic Garden Stuff Pack.

2 Golden Years Kit

A Chance For Older Sims To Shine

  • DLC type : Kit
  • Release date : May 2025

Older Sims often find themselves forgotten, so it's wonderful to see a kit that embraces the comfort, class, and coziness of life for those Sims who are forever young at heart. The clothing available is tailored specifically for a slow-paced elderly lifestyle , including accessories like glasses and gardening gloves, allowing aging Sims to enjoy a cozy, leisurely retirement to the fullest.

Gameplay for elderly Sims is severely lacking, especially in the base game, so additional content like Golden Years is a positive step in the right direction.

3 Comfy Gamer Kit

The Perfect Kit For Gamers To Show Off Their Unique Style

  • DLC type : Kit
  • Release date : January 2025

The Comfy Gamer kit allows players to bring a little of their own flair to the in-game world. It was designed in collaboration with popular YouTuber and member of the EA Creator Network, Lilsimsie , and is one of several recent creator kits with cozy vibes, including the Sweet Allure fashion kit by aharris00britney and the Cozy Kitsch kit by myshunosun.

The kit includes a range of adorable items, including notice boards, desk tidies, and Sims-themed dcor. Its a fun edition for any player who wants to share their hobbies with their favorite Sims.

4 Nifty Knitting Stuff Pack

A Cozy New Hobby For Sims

  • DLC type : Stuff Pack
  • Release date : July 2020

The Nifty Knitting pack introduces lots of cozy fun to the game, allowing players to craft cute items, including toys, rugs, and clothing, from the comfort of their rocking chair. These items can then be gifted to family and friends, or Sims can turn their new hobby into a side hustle by selling items on the games new online marketplace , known as "Plopsy."

With a whole range of new CAS and build mode items, the pack is a welcome addition for cozy gamers.

5 Crystal Creations Stuff Pack

The Perfect Pack For Crafty Gamers

  • DLC type : Stuff Pack
  • Release date : February 2024

Crystal Creations is a pack praised for its rich gameplay, and is a great expansion for Simmers who love to play with fashion, allowing them to sit down at the Gemology table to create, sell, and wear their own jewelry made from eye-catching gems and rare metals, which they can harvest in the game world.

Players also have the chance to connect with their spirituality and the natural world by charging their crystals, enriching them with the ability to change Sims moods.

6 Tiny Living Stuff Pack

Minimalist Living For Gamers Who Like A Challenge

  • DLC type : Stuff Pack
  • Release date : January 2020

Tiny Living emphasizes simple living and making the most out of what you have. It introduces space-saving furniture builds , such as folding beds and corner furniture, in order to make even the tiniest of homes a joy to be in, and introduces a new lot type that challenges players to get creative with the small amount of space they have to work with.

It also comes with some cozy clothing items to spice up players CAS. Paired with the Book Nook Kit, this Stuff Pack makes for a truly cozy home experience.

7 Eco Lifestyle Expansion Pack

A Chance To Live Off-The-Grid

  • DLC type : Expansion Pack
  • Release date : July 2021

Eco Lifestyle is the perfect pack for those interested in escaping the grind and living a simple, eco-conscious lifestyle. It allows players to live sustainably, with an emphasis on minimizing consumption and building a cozy community . The better players treat the world around them, the more nature and their community will thrive.

However, Eco Lifestyle also introduced some whackier elements, like the neighborhood action plans, which allow local Sims to vote on community rules. This can lead to some bizarre rules being put in place, such as legalized theft and fines for using electronics.

8 Island Living Expansion Pack

A Dreamy, Humid Retreat To A Secluded Paradise

  • DLC type : Expansion Pack
  • Release date : June 2019

Island Living introduces Simmers to the stunning Island of Sulani, a tropical getaway with lush oceans and a rich local culture. Its the perfect escape from reality, an ideal place to catch some rays, build a sandcastle, or even befriend a mermaid . Island Living also adds a beautiful hidden area, much like the base games enchanting Sylvan Glade, as players can explore the Cave of Sulani to uncover its secrets.

The beautiful game world is the ideal vacation world for hard-working Sims, though the pack has been criticized for lacking gameplay.

9 Cats & Dogs Expansion Pack

Adding Forgotten Family Members Into The Game

  • DLC type : Expansion Pack
  • Release date : November 2017

No simulation of family life is complete without beloved pets, and many Simmers cite the Cats and Dogs expansion pack as an essential alongside packs such as Seasons. With this pack, players can welcome pets into their Sims' household and create lasting memories .

The pack stirred some controversy with the release of the My First Pet Stuff Pack, a DLC that would only work if players had already purchased the larger pets DLC. Players can also add horses to the game with the purchase of the Horse Ranch expansion pack.

10 Cottage Living Expansion Pack

A Charming Taste Of English Countryside Life

  • DLC type : Expansion Pack
  • Release date : July 2021

Of all the Sims DLC that allow players to wrap themselves up in a cozy world, none so far has done it better than the Cottage Living Expansion Pack. Cottage Living transforms your Sims world into a snug English countryside village , Henford-on-Bagley, a charming neighborhood where players can raise animals, take part in country fairs, and befriend the adorable local wildlife, including rabbits and foxes.

The pack adds a wardrobe of thick, cozy knits to the players' CAS, as well as the ability to cross-stitch, giving players the quintessential cozy experience.

item.title: Oxygen Not Included: 7 Things To Do First
item.description:
Players who are new to Oxygen Not Included would find themselves having a lot of early game issues due to how unforgiving the game can be when problems arise. Not swiftly addressing these issues will lead to catastrophic events, like having germs all over the base, having Duplicants with extreme stress response, and ultimately, losing a Duplicant as they pass away.

For that, it's important to know what to do first in Oxygen Not Included . Having a strong foundation that fulfills the Duplicants' needs will guarantee players' survival for a long time. Even if they're not fulfilling the end-game goals, knowing how to survive is one step closer to those shiny achievements.

7 Choose Your First Duplicants

Don't Underestimate The Negative Traits

When players start a new game in Oxygen Not Included , it's highly recommended to have one digger and one researcher, with the third Duplicants (Dupes) being another digger or a builder. These roles can be customized using the arrow button next to Reroll on top of the Duplicant selection box.

Picking these roles specifically allows players to immediately have a Dupe that's good at digging and researching, meaning it's easier to expand the base later.

6 Create Different Schedules

Congregating At The Great Hall

Your Duplicants have work, break, and sleep times. During the break, they will go to the bathroom, eat, and rest. Because of this, it's crucial to spread resting times between Duplicants . If they all have the same break time, there will be times when no one is attending to the base, which can be detrimental if a utility becomes unavailable in the middle of break or sleep time. This also minimizes the number of Outhouses needed, since they won't go to the bathroom at the same time.

Next, set a Duplicant Priority for your Duplicants. This will make a Dupe focus on their high-priority task. For example, a Dupe with high Science should prioritize research, whereas the digger should prioritize digging. There's also a Building Priority feature to make a Duplicant focus on certain tasks, or even force them to leave everything and do the task you want with the Top Priority button (red button with exclamation marks). Make sure to only assign a high priority to tasks that are extremely important, since if everything is important, the Dupe will just treat them equally.

Press period to assign schedule, L for Duplicant Priority, and P to set priority for different tasks.

5 Find Water And Build An Outhouse

Just Go To The Bathroom!

After entering the game, the next steps are to find water sources and build an Outhouse . This is a high-priority step, since your Dupes will spread germs and polluted water if there's no place to relieve themselves.

Place the Great Hall (dining room) above the Latrine (toilet), as Dupes always go to the restroom before eating.

Once a water pool is in sight, dig into it and place a Pitcher Pump (make sure the pipe touches the water) so that the Duplicants can get water. Next, build an Outhouse nearby along with a Wash Basin for the Dupes to go to the bathroom and wash their hands. Without a place to wash their hands, the Duplicants will also spread germs all over the base, so make sure not to miss this step. Additionally, it's highly recommended to build a Latrine room for Morale boost. A room can be made simply by making sure the surrounding areas are closed off by walls, tiles, or doors .

4 Make Barracks With Cots

Sleep Like A Baby

Once a proper toilet is set, the next step is to ensure the Duplicants aren't sleeping on the floor. For this, build a Cot for them. Like with the Outhouses, players can make Barracks by closing off the openings with walls or doors.

It's highly recommended to make Barracks four-tiles high, so it's easier to switch to Luxury Barracks later.

For a further Morale boost, start researching the Mess Table , Water Cooler , and Flower Pot to create a dining room called the Great Hall .

3 Research Quickly

Get Access To Advanced Items

As it's already mentioned, one of the first things players should aim for is completing crucial research. Players can use the Printing Pod as an early light source to enable the Laboratory room. Close the walls, then simply build two Research Stations to enable the lab. Make sure to put the Manual Generator outside the room , as it's not allowed inside the Laboratory.

Additionally, the starting Battery is a small one, so leave one tile of space to replace it with a better Battery later. Finally, connect all the structures together with a Wire to get them running.

2 Small Farm To Keep You Running

Don't Starve Together

Oxygen Not Included provides a small amount of food at the start of the game, but players quickly have to find alternative solutions once the other basic structures are made. As players research the Mess Table, they should have already unlocked the Planter Box . The easiest early-game food is planting Mealwood , but later on, it's better to switch to other plants like Bristle Blossom or Dusk Cap . Don't rely on Mealwood without figuring out how to renew Dirt, because although Dirt is abundant in the early game, players can run out if they only use it without finding renewable methods.

It's best to pick a space under the base where carbon dioxide pools so that the plants can always have enough gas pressure as required for their growing requirements.

One of the ways to renew Dirt is by ranching Pip . On the Terra Asteroid, Pip is available as a random care package from the Printing Pod. Plant Thimble Reed or Arbor Tree to feed them. Players can make a Pip plant the plant's seeds on a natural tile or build a Hydroponic Farm that takes Polluted Water. The Polluted Water can be sourced directly from a Lavatory or Shower , reducing the need to handle the germ-filled waste.

1 Generate Oxygen

Just Keep Breathing

At the start of the game, some Oxylite tiles emit Oxygen, allowing the Dupes to breathe. But the reserve will eventually deplete, meaning players must find new sources of Oxygen. The easiest way to generate Oxygen is by using an Oxygen Diffuser or Algae Terrarium , but Algae will quickly run out through this method, so it's crucial to quickly explore other options.

In the Terra Asteroid, there will be a good amount of water, so the best Oxygen generator is the Electrolyzer . The machine will generate Oxygen and Hydrogen, so it's important to have them generated in a closed room and only spread Oxygen around the base. The best setup for this method is the Hydrogen Self-Powering Oxygen Module/Machine (SPOM), where the Hydrogen from the Electrolyzer is directed to a Hydrogen Generator to generate power, meaning the entire setup can power itself.
